N Line - Weekend and Weekday Planned Service Changes

WEEKEND 11:45 PM Fri to 5 AM Mon, Apr 29 - May 2 Downtown N trains skip 49 St. 12:01 AM Sat to 5 AM Mon, Apr 30 - May 2 Coney Island-bound N trains run local from DeKalb Av to 59 St. All times until Spring 2017 Astoria-bound N trains skip 86 St, Avenue U, Kings Hwy, 20 Av, 18 Av, New Utrecht Av, and Fort Hamilton Pkwy. N trains stop at Bay Pkwy and 8 Av. To 86 St, Avenue U, and Kings Hwy, take the Astoria-bound N to Bay Pkwy and transfer to a Coney Island-bound N. To 20 Av, 18 Av, New Utrecht Av, and Fort Hamilton Pkwy, take the Astoria-bound N to 8 Av and transfer to a Coney Island-bound N. From these stations, take a Coney Island-bound N to Bay Pkwy or Stillwell Av and transfer to an Astoria-bound N. Or, from New Utrecht Av-62 St, take the D instead. Transfer to an Astoria-bound N at 36 St.
L Line - Weekend and Weekday Planned Service Changes

11:30 PM Fri to 5 AM Mon, Apr 29 - May 2 No L trains between Rockaway Pkwy and Myrtle-Wyckoff Avs. Take free express and local shuttle buses and A/C or J trains. Free local shuttle buses provide alternate service between Rockaway Pkwy and Myrtle-Wyckoff Avs, stopping at East 105 St, New Lots Av, Livonia Av, Sutter Av, Atlantic Av, Broadway Junction, Bushwick Av-Aberdeen St, Wilson Av, and Halsey St. Free express shuttle buses serve Rockaway Pkwy, Broadway Junction, and Myrtle-Wyckoff Avs only, days and evenings. Transfer between free shuttle buses and L trains at Myrtle-Wyckoff Avs. To/from Manhattan, consider the A/C or J via transfer between trains and shuttle buses at Broadway Junction. Take LIRR to Islanders Playoff Hockey Wednesday, April 20

Take LIRR to Islanders Playoff Hockey Wednesday, April 20

LIRR is providing additional service to/from Barclays Center on Wednesday, April 20 as the NY Islanders take on the Florida Panthers in playoff hockey action in Brooklyn. To avoid transfers at Jamaica use direct service to/from Atlantic terminal on Hempstead & Far Rockaway branches. Save time and money by buying your round-trip ticket before boarding the train and remember to take your ticket with you when transferring at Jamaica. For more info see http://bit.ly/1XA65zv

Ronkonkoma Branch Service Suspended Between Ronkonkoma and Farmingdale

Service is suspended on the Ronkonkoma Branch in both directions between Ronkonkoma and Farmingdale stations due to an unauthorized tractor trailer on the tracks east of Deer Park Station. LIRR personnel are en route to assess possible third rail damage. Buses are in the process of being secured, but are not on scene at this time. Customers are advised to use alternate branches, such as the Montauk or Port Jefferson branches.

Devon Transfer Returns to Service April 3

Devon Transfer-a temporary transfer point where the Waterbury Branch and New Haven Line meet-- will return to service with our next schedule change on Sunday, April 3. Prior to the initial phase of work last year on Devon Bridge, the transfer station was built by Metro-North forces and was well-received by Waterbury Branch customers. The following changes will be in effect for Waterbury Branch customers through October: - Southbound customers who usually transfer to main line trains at Bridgeport will instead get off at Devon Transfer Station. - Customers who travel to New Haven will transfer again at Bridgeport for a main line train to New Haven. - Northbound customers will be dropped off main line trains at Devon Transfer Station and board a waiting train for Waterbury.

Devon Transfer Returns to Service April 3

Devon Transfer-a temporary transfer point where the Waterbury Branch and New Haven Line meet-- will return to service with our next schedule change on Sunday, April 3. Prior to the initial phase of work last year on Devon Bridge, the transfer station was built by Metro-North forces and was well-received by Waterbury Branch customers. The following changes will be in effect for Waterbury Branch customers through October: Southbound customers who usually transfer to main line trains at Bridgeport will instead get off at Devon Transfer Station. Customers who travel to New Haven will transfer again at Bridgeport for a main line train to New Haven. Northbound customers will be dropped off main line trains at Devon Transfer Station and board a waiting train for Waterbury. See full details at www.bit.ly/1a5iYhw See schedules at http://bit.ly/1arccwk

Our new timetables, which go into effect Sunday, April 3, look to improve performance in peak periods and accommodate track outages for crucial infrastructure work. See full details at http://bit.ly/1R0hQy8 Be sure to check a new timetable for possible changes to your travel. They are available in Grand Central and at outlying stations, via our free TrainTime App for Apple and Android devices, and on our schedules page at http://bit.ly/1arccwk

Devon Transfer Returns to Service April 3

Devon Transfer-a temporary transfer point where the Waterbury Branch and New Haven Line meet-- will return to service with our next schedule change on Sunday, April 3. Prior to the initial phase of work last year on Devon Bridge, the transfer station was built by Metro-North forces and was well-received by Waterbury Branch customers. The following changes will be in effect for Waterbury Branch customers through October: Southbound customers who usually transfer to main line trains at Bridgeport will instead get off at Devon Transfer Station. Customers who travel to New Haven will transfer again at Bridgeport for a main line train to New Haven. Northbound customers will be dropped off main line trains at Devon Transfer Station and board a waiting train for Waterbury. See full details at www.bit.ly/1a5iYhw . See schedules at http://bit.ly/1arccwk

Our new timetables, which go into effect Sunday, April 3, look to improve performance in peak periods and accommodate track outages for crucial infrastructure work. See full details at http://bit.ly/1R0hQy8 Be sure to check a new timetable for possible changes to your travel. They are available in Grand Central and at outlying stations, via our free TrainTime App for Apple and Android devices, and on our schedules page at http://bit.ly/1arccwk
Devon Transfer Returns to Service April 3

Devon Transfer-a temporary transfer point where the Waterbury Branch and New Haven Line meet-- will return to service with our next schedule change on Sunday, April 3. Prior to the initial phase of work last year on Devon Bridge, the transfer station was built by Metro-North forces and was well-received by Waterbury Branch customers. The following changes will be in effect for Waterbury Branch customers through October: Southbound customers who usually transfer to main line trains at Bridgeport will instead get off at Devon Transfer Station. Customers who travel to New Haven will transfer again at Bridgeport for a main line train to New Haven. Northbound customers will be dropped off main line trains at Devon Transfer Station and board a waiting train for Waterbury. See full details at www.bit.ly/1a5iYhw See schedules at http://bit.ly/1arccwk

N Line - Weekday and Weekend Planned Service Changes

All times until Spring 2017 Astoria-bound N trains skip 86 St, Avenue U, Kings Hwy, 20 Av, 18 Av, New Utrecht Av, and Fort Hamilton Pkwy. N trains stop at Bay Pkwy and 8 Av. To 86 St, Avenue U, and Kings Hwy, take the Astoria-bound N to Bay Pkwy and transfer to a Coney Island-bound N. To 20 Av, 18 Av, New Utrecht Av, and Fort Hamilton Pkwy, take the Astoria-bound N to 8 Av and transfer to a Coney Island-bound N. From these stations, take a Coney Island-bound N to Bay Pkwy or Stillwell Av and transfer to an Astoria-bound N. Or, from New Utrecht Av-62 St, take the D instead. Transfer to an Astoria-bound N at 36 St.
M Line - Weekday and Weeknight Planned Service Changes

NIGHTS Beginning 8:30 PM, Mon to Thu, Apr 4 - 7 M service ends early between 71 Av and Delancey-Essex Sts. Take the E/F/R instead.
